Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; creamy white slip; interior glazed black with added red and added white lotus flower; below, red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of upper part of male figure (most of head lost, but beard visible) to right, wearing sleeved chiton and black himation with red dots.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 278, no. 752, pl. III, pl. 98)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0727) (phase 2)
